Traders reported only modest industry buying while talk continued of widespread smuggling of Ivory Coast beans into neighbouring African countries. The export ban is presumably due to end in about 1.5 weeks but with political deadlock continuing in Ivory Coast no one can really forecast what will happen, one trader said.`` Industry can take a month-long export stop but a longer stop would cause problems.''
